newsitem.title: USA: US says First Tennessee Natl settles suit.
newsitem.headline: US says First Tennessee Natl settles suit.

text.p: The U.S. Justice Department said Tuesday that a First Tennessee National Corp unit has agreed to pay $2.75 million to settle allegations it deceived the Education Department to get federal insurance on defaulted student loans.
Department officials said the settlement resolved a civil lawsuit that had been filed against the unit in Knoxville.

The suit claimed the unit, First Tennessee Bank, National Association, submitted false claims in 1987 and 1988 to receive federally guaranteed insurance payments under a program that made low-interest loans to students at post-secondary schools.

According to the suit, which was filed in 1994, the unit submitted fabricated collection histories to collect insurance on more than $1.3 million in loans and forged documents on more than $200,000 in other loans, department officials said.
